intro: Forestiera chiapensis, commonly known as Chiapan forestiera, is a shrub native to the cloud forests of southern Mexico. It belongs to the Oleaceae family, which includes plants like jasmine and lilac. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and opposite, providing a dense canopy in its natural habitat. Forestiera chiapensis is adapted to humid, shaded environments and plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
